t: Exodus 6
But*p the Lord*s replied to Moses, “Now you will see what I will do to Pharaoh: because of a strong hand he will let them go, and because of a strong hand he will drive them from his land.”
God Promises Freedom
Then*p God spoke to Moses, telling him, “I am the Lord.*s
I appeared to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob as God Almighty, but I was not known to them by my name ‘the Lord.’*s
I also established my covenant with them to give them the land of Canaan, the land they lived in as aliens.
Furthermore, I have heard the groaning of the Israelites, whom the Egyptians are forcing to work as slaves, and I have remembered my covenant.

“Therefore*p tell the Israelites: I am the Lord,*s and I will bring you out from the forced labor of the Egyptians and rescue you from slavery to them. I will redeem you with an outstretched arm and great acts of judgment.
I will take you as my people, and I will be your God. You will know that I am the Lord*s your God, who brought you out from the forced labor of the Egyptians.
I will bring you to the land that I swore to give to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, and I will give it to you as a possession. I am the Lord.”*s
Moses told this to the Israelites, but they did not listen to him because of their broken spirit and hard labor.
Then*p the Lord*s spoke to Moses,
“Go and tell Pharaoh king of Egypt to let the Israelites go from his land.”
But*p Moses said in the Lord’s*s presence, “If the Israelites will not listen to me, then how will Pharaoh listen to me, since I am such a poor speaker?”
Then the Lord*s spoke to Moses and Aaron and gave them commands concerning both the Israelites and Pharaoh king of Egypt to bring the Israelites out of the land of Egypt.
Genealogy of Moses and Aaron
These*p are the heads of their fathers’ families: The*ln sons of Reuben, the firstborn of Israel: Hanoch*ln and Pallu, Hezron and Carmi. These*ln are the clans of Reuben.
The*ln sons of Simeon: Jemuel,*ln Jamin, Ohad, Jachin, Zohar,*ln and Shaul, the son of a Canaanite woman. These*ln are the clans of Simeon.
These*ln are the names of the sons of Levi according*ln to their family records; Gershon,*ln Kohath, and Merari. Levi*ln lived 137 years.
The*ln sons of Gershon: Libni*ln and Shimei, by their clans.
The*ln sons of Kohath: Amram,*ln Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel. Kohath*ln lived 133 years.
The*ln sons of Merari: Mahli*ln and Mushi. These*ln are the clans of the Levites according*ln to their family records.
Amram*ln married his father’s sister Jochebed, and*ln she bore him Aaron and Moses. Amram*ln lived 137 years.
The*ln sons of Izhar: Korah,*ln Nepheg, and Zichri.
The*ln sons of Uzziel: Mishael,*ln Elzaphan, and Sithri.
Aaron*ln married Elisheba, daughter*ln of Amminadab and sister of Nahshon. She*ln bore him Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
The*ln sons of Korah: Assir,*ln Elkanah, and Abiasaph. These*ln are the clans of the Korahites.
Aaron’s*ln son Eleazar married one*ln of the daughters of Putiel, and*ln she bore him Phinehas. These*ln are the heads of the Levite families by their clans.
It*p was this Aaron and Moses whom the Lord*s told, “Bring the Israelites out of the land of Egypt according to their military divisions.”
Moses and Aaron were the ones who spoke to Pharaoh king of Egypt in order to bring the Israelites out of Egypt.
Moses and Aaron before Pharaoh
On*p the day the Lord*s spoke to Moses in the land of Egypt,
he said to him, “I am the Lord;*s tell Pharaoh king of Egypt everything I am telling you.”
But*p Moses replied in the Lord’s*s presence, “Since I am such a poor speaker, how will Pharaoh listen to me?”
